ZoomIn.helpDescription: The new content is "zoomed in" from the center and grows to fill the full content area.
ZoomIn.description: The new content is "zoomed in" from the center and grows to fill the full content area.

SlideRight.helpDescription: The new slides in from the left (to the right).
SlideRight.description: The new slides in from the left (to the right).

ZoomOut.helpDescription: The old content is "zoomed out", i.e. shrinks to a point at the center of the content area.
ZoomOut.description: The old content is "zoomed out", i.e. shrinks to a point at the center of the content area.

Rotate.helpDescription: The new content rotates in. (Just like one of those old newspaper-animations.)
Rotate.description: The new content rotates in. (Just like one of those old newspaper-animations.)

None.helpDescription: No animation. Content is switched instantly.
None.description: No animation. Content is switched instantly.

SlideOver.helpDescription: The new content slides in from the left while the old content slides out to the left at the same time.
SlideOver.description: The new content slides in from the left while the old content slides out to the left at the same time.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month.helpDescription:
renders a month with ItemNavigation
This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage
If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent
(To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

select.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

focus.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

renders a month with ItemNavigation
This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage

ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

specialDates.helpDescription:
Date Range with type to visualize special days in the Calendar.
If one day is assigned to more than one Type, only the first one will be used.
specialDates.description:
Date Range with type to visualize special days in the Calendar.
If one day is assigned to more than one Type, only the first one will be used.

selectedDates.helpDescription: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker
selectedDates.description: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker

singleSelection.helpDescription: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected
singleSelection.description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

intervalSelection.helpDescription: If set, interval selection is allowed
intervalSelection.description: If set, interval selection is allowed

nonWorkingDays.helpDescription:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.
Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6.
If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.
nonWorkingDays.description:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.
Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6.
If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

showHeader.helpDescription: If set, a header with the month name is shown
showHeader.description: If set, a header with the month name is shown

date.helpDescription: the month including this date is rendered and this date is initial focused (if no other focus set)
date.description: the month including this date is rendered and this date is initial focused (if no other focus set)

firstDayOfWeek.helpDescription:
If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6.
If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.
firstDayOfWeek.description:
If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6.
If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.

sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.helpDescription: Smallest unit in the menu hierarchy. An item can be a direct part of a menu bar, of a menu, or of a sub menu.
sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.description: Smallest unit in the menu hierarchy. An item can be a direct part of a menu bar, of a menu, or of a sub menu.

submenu.helpDescription: Aggregation of a menu item's sub menu.
submenu.description: Aggregation of a menu item's sub menu.

enabled.helpDescription: Disabled items have different colors, depending on customer settings.
enabled.description: Disabled items have different colors, depending on customer settings.

startsSection.helpDescription: If set to true, a divider is displayed before the item
startsSection.description: If set to true, a divider is displayed before the item

sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.helpDescription: ShellOverlay to be opened in front of a sap.ui.unified.Shell

closed.helpDescription: Fired when the overlay was closed.
closed.description: Fired when the overlay was closed.
closed.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.description: ShellOverlay to be opened in front of a sap.ui.unified.Shell

shell.helpDescription: Reference to the sap.ui.unified.Shell or sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout control.
shell.description: Reference to the sap.ui.unified.Shell or sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout control.

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

content.helpDescription: The content to appear in the overlay.

search.helpDescription: Experimental (This aggregation might change in future!): The search control which should be displayed in the overlay header.
search.description: Experimental (This aggregation might change in future!): The search control which should be displayed in the overlay header.

sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.helpDescription: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

uploadAborted.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadAborted.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadAborted.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

fileSizeExceed.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
fileSizeExceed.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
fileSizeExceed.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

uploadComplete.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadComplete.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadComplete.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

uploadProgress.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadProgress.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadProgress.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

change.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
change.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
change.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

uploadStart.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadStart.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
uploadStart.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

fileAllowed.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
fileAllowed.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
fileAllowed.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

filenameLengthExceed.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
filenameLengthExceed.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
filenameLengthExceed.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

typeMissmatch.helpDescription: Event is fired before an upload is started.
typeMissmatch.description: Event is fired before an upload is started.
typeMissmatch.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

headerParameters.helpDescription: The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
headerParameters.description: The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

parameters.helpDescription: The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden inputfield.
parameters.description: The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden inputfield.

maximumFileSize.helpDescription: A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
maximumFileSize.description: A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

valueState.helpDescription: Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None.
valueState.description: Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None.

sameFilenameAllowed.helpDescription: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.
sameFilenameAllowed.description: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

uploadOnChange.helpDescription: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.
uploadOnChange.description: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.

style.helpDescription: Style of the button. "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" is allowed.
style.description: Style of the button. "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" is allowed.

name.helpDescription: Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.
name.description: Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

value.helpDescription: Value of the path for file upload.
value.description: Value of the path for file upload.

multiple.helpDescription: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
multiple.description: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

mimeType.helpDescription:
The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].
mimeType.description:
The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

iconFirst.helpDescription: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.
iconFirst.description: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.

uploadUrl.helpDescription: Used when URL address is on a remote server.
uploadUrl.description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

enabled.helpDescription: Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.
enabled.description: Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.

icon.helpDescription:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button.
This can be an URI to an image or an icon font URI.
icon.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button.
This can be an URI to an image or an icon font URI.

fileType.helpDescription:
The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented.
Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].
fileType.description:
The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented.
Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

iconHovered.helpDescription:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used.
If a icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.
iconHovered.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used.
If a icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

useMultipart.helpDescription: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
useMultipart.description: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

additionalData.helpDescription: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data.
additionalData.description: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data.

sendXHR.helpDescription: If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
sendXHR.description: If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

maximumFilenameLength.helpDescription: The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.
maximumFilenameLength.description: The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.

buttonOnly.helpDescription: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.
buttonOnly.description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.

iconSelected.helpDescription:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used.
If a icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.
iconSelected.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used.
If a icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

buttonText.helpDescription: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.
buttonText.description: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.

iconOnly.helpDescription: If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.
iconOnly.description: If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem.helpDescription: Header Action item of the Shell.

press.helpDescription: Event is fired when the user presses the item.
press.description: Event is fired when the user presses the item.
press.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem.description: Header Action item of the Shell.

ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

icon.helpDescription: The icon of the item, either defined in the sap.ui.core.IconPool or an URI to a custom image. An icon must be set.
icon.description: The icon of the item, either defined in the sap.ui.core.IconPool or an URI to a custom image. An icon must be set.

showMarker.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.18 Markers should not be used anymore.
If set to true, a theme dependent marker is shown on the item.
showMarker.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.18 Markers should not be used anymore.
If set to true, a theme dependent marker is shown on the item.

selected.helpDescription: If set to true, the item gets a special design.
selected.description: If set to true, the item gets a special design.

showSeparator.helpDescription: If set to true, a separator is displayed after the item.
showSeparator.description: If set to true, a separator is displayed after the item.

visible.helpDescription: Invisible items are not shown on the UI.
visible.description: Invisible items are not shown on the UI.

startsSection.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.18 Dividers are not supported anymore.
If set to true, a divider is displayed before the item.
startsSection.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.18 Dividers are not supported anymore.
If set to true, a divider is displayed before the item.

sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange.helpDescription: Date range with calendar day type information. Used to visualize special days in the Calendar.
sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange.description: Date range with calendar day type information. Used to visualize special days in the Calendar.

startDate.helpDescription: Start date for a date range. This must be a JavaScript date object.
startDate.description: Start date for a date range. This must be a JavaScript date object.

endDate.helpDescription: Start date for a date range. If empty only a single date is presented by this DateRange element. This must be a JavaScript date object.
endDate.description: Start date for a date range. If empty only a single date is presented by this DateRange element. This must be a JavaScript date object.

sap.ui.unified.Shell.helpDescription:
The shell control is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application.
It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities
for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and
do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.
sap.ui.unified.Shell.description:
The shell control is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application.
It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities
for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and
do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

content.helpDescription: The content to appear in the main canvas.
content.description: The content to appear in the main canvas.

curtainSplitContainer.helpDescription: Private storage for the internal split container for the curtain.
curtainSplitContainer.description: Private storage for the internal split container for the curtain.

search.helpDescription: Experimental (This aggregation might change in future!): The search control which should be displayed in the shell header. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.
search.description: Experimental (This aggregation might change in future!): The search control which should be displayed in the shell header. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

headItems.helpDescription: The buttons shown in the begin (left in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.
headItems.description: The buttons shown in the begin (left in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

curtainContent.helpDescription: The content to appear in the curtain area.
curtainContent.description: The content to appear in the curtain area.

curtainPaneContent.helpDescription: The content to appear in the pane area of the curtain.
curtainPaneContent.description: The content to appear in the pane area of the curtain.

canvasSplitContainer.helpDescription: Private storage for the internal split container for the canvas.
canvasSplitContainer.description: Private storage for the internal split container for the canvas.

user.helpDescription: The user item which is rendered in the shell header beside the items. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.
user.description: The user item which is rendered in the shell header beside the items. If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

headEndItems.helpDescription: The buttons shown in the end (right in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported (when user is set only 1). If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.
headEndItems.description: The buttons shown in the end (right in left-to-right case) of the Shell header. Currently max. 3 visible buttons are supported (when user is set only 1). If a custom header is set this aggregation has no effect.

header.helpDescription: The control to appear in the header area.
header.description: The control to appear in the header area.

paneContent.helpDescription: The content to appear in the pane area.
paneContent.description: The content to appear in the pane area.

headerVisible.helpDescription: If set to false, no header (and no items, search, ...) is shown.
headerVisible.description: If set to false, no header (and no items, search, ...) is shown.

icon.helpDescription: The application icon. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.
icon.description: The application icon. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.

showCurtain.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.3 Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.
Shows / Hides the curtain.
showCurtain.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.3 Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.
Shows / Hides the curtain.

searchVisible.helpDescription: If set to false, the search area (aggregation 'search') is hidden. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.
searchVisible.description: If set to false, the search area (aggregation 'search') is hidden. If a custom header is set this property has no effect.

showCurtainPane.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.3 Curtain is deprecated and replaced by ShellOverlay mechanism.
Shows / Hides the side pane on the curtain.

headerHiding.helpDescription: Whether the header can be hidden (manually or automatically). This feature is only available when touch events are supported.

If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.

maxPrecision.description: Defines the space that is available for the precision of the various currencies.

useSymbol.description: Show the currency symbol instead of the ISO currency code

showPopupIndicator.helpDescription:

orientation.description: Whether to show the secondary content on the left ("Horizontal", default) or on the top ("Vertical").

secondaryContentWidth.helpDescription:

endDate.helpDescription: Start date for a date range. If empty only a single date is presented by this DateRange element. This must be a JavaScript date object.

number of months displayed

nonWorkingDays.helpDescription:
If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.
Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6.
If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days.

days.helpDescription:
number of days displayed
on phones the maximum rendered number of days is 8.

number of days displayed
on phones the maximum rendered number of days is 8.

firstDayOfWeek.helpDescription:
If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6.
If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.
firstDayOfWeek.description:
If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend.helpDescription: A legend for the Calendar Control. Displays special dates colors with their corresponding description. The aggregation specialDates can be set herefor.

columnWidth.helpDescription: Width of the columns created in which the items are arranged.

sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcher.description: Switches between two control areas and animates it via CSS transitions

content1.helpDescription: The controls that should be shown in the first content

content2.helpDescription: The controls that should be shown in the second content
content2.description: The controls that should be shown in the second content

animation.helpDescription:
Set the used animation when changing content. This just sets a CSS-class named "sapUiUnifiedACSwitcherAnimation" + this value on the root element of the control. The animation has to be implemented in CSS. This also enables applications to implement their own animations via CSS by reacting to the parent class.
See the types sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation for default implementations.
animation.description:
Set the used animation when changing content. This just sets a CSS-class named "sapUiUnifiedACSwitcherAnimation" + this value on the root element of the control. The animation has to be implemented in CSS. This also enables applications to implement their own animations via CSS by reacting to the parent class.
See the types sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation for default implementations.

activeContent.helpDescription: The number of the currently active content (1 or 2).
activeContent.description: The number of the currently active content (1 or 2).

sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout.helpDescription:
The shell layout is the base for the shell control which is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application.
It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities
for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and
do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

The shell layout is the base for the shell control which is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application.

for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and
do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

Start date of the row

sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.helpDescription: Provides the standard properties for menu items.

select.helpDescription:
Event is fired when an item is selected. The event is also available for items having a sub menu.
A mouse click or space bar click on a sub menu item fires the event.

number of months in each row

sap.ui.unified.Menu.helpDescription: A container for menu items. When the space in the browser is not large enough to display all defined items, a scroll bar is provided.

itemSelect.helpDescription:
Provides the application an alternative option to listen to select events. This event is only fired on the root menu of a menu hierarchy.
Note that there is also a select event available for MenuItem; if the current event is used, the select event of a MenuItem becomes redundant.
itemSelect.description:
Provides the application an alternative option to listen to select events. This event is only fired on the root menu of a menu hierarchy.
Note that there is also a select event available for MenuItem; if the current event is used, the select event of a MenuItem becomes redundant.
itemSelect.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

enabled.helpDescription: Disabled menus have other colors than enabled ones, depending on customer settings.

maxVisibleItems.helpDescription:
Max. number of items to be displayed before an overflow mechanimn appears. Values smaller than 1 mean infinite number of visible items.
The menu can not become larger than the screen height.
